question: Losartan and Candesartan bind to angiotensin II receptors. Candesartan has a dissociative half-life of ~1-2 hrs while Losartan has a dissociative half-life of ~5 min. Based on this information, which drug has a lower $K_d$ value and hence binds to the angiotensin II receptor with higher affinity?

answers.feedback: Correct. The clinical efficacy of Losartan and Candesartan in hypertensive patients suggested that Candesartan produced a significant reduction in blood pressure at lower doses (16 mg/day) compared to Losartan (100 mg/day).
